Dear Parents,

The safety of your child and our staff is of utmost importance as we return to school. During the school year, we are asking you to daily check your child for signs of COVID-19. Below is a checklist of statements you may use as a reference. If your child exhibits any of the following signs listed below please keep them at home. This checklist must be used separately for each child attending school from your household. You can print a checklist/log from our website at www.empireschools.org.

_____ 1. Does your child have a temperature of 100 degrees or more today?
_____ 2. Does your child have a sore throat?
_____ 3. Does your child have a cough?
_____ 4. Does your child have a loss of smell or taste?
_____ 5. Does your child have shortness of breath?
_____ 6. Does your child have close contact with a positive COVID case?
By sending your child(ren) to school, you agree the answer to each of the statements above is â€œNo.â€

Thank you,

Justin Smith
Superintendent, Empire Public Schools

Dear Parents/Guardians/
As many of you know our school is experiencing several cases of flu/strep/stomach viruses. Today our absent rate exceeded more than 20% for the second day in a row; therefore, we have decided to cancel school for Friday, January 19th. By doing this we are hoping our custodial staff can disinfect more effectively and it will also give our students/staff an extra day to get healthy.

We do apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, but we do put our student's health and safety as our number one concern. Thank you for understanding and we hope everyone stays healthy.

Upon returning to school please make sure you do not send your child/children back until they have been fever free without fever reducing medicine for 24 hours to prevent this further.

Thanks,
Empire Public School

Pre-k enrollment for the 2017-2018 school year will be held March 29th from 12-4 in the elementary office.
At the time of enrollment parents will need to provide:
1-A copy of the child's birth certificate
2-Up-to-date immunization record
3-Proof of residence (with parents name and street address)
4-Social security card
Students will not be enrolled until all the above paperwork is turned in.
A $30.00 supply fee will be collected at a parent/teacher meeting before school starts (date tbd).
To qualify for pre-k, a child must be 4 years old on or before September 1st, 2017 (no exceptions).
